arts.ttl: Wrexham gets a rude welcome to the Championship as Southampton twice strikes late for 2-1 win
arts.sum: Wrexham was denied a Hollywood-style ending on its return to English soccer’s second tier on Saturday when relegated Premier League team Southampton struck twice in the final minutes to grab a 2-1 win. Wrexham signed Coady from Leicester — he arrived with 198 games of Premier League experience.

arts.ttl: Wrexham trolled by Southampton after their Championship debut ends in nightmare
arts.sum: Southampton revelled in their 2-1 comeback win over Wrexham in the Championship by poking fun at their Hollywood-owned opponents following their late show at St Mary's

arts.ttl: Saints strike TWICE in injury-time! | Southampton 2-1 Wrexham
arts.sum: Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship match between Southampton and Wrexham.

arts.ttl: Wrexham stunned by late Southampton goals
arts.sum: Wrexham suffered a double gut punch as Southampton struck twice late on for a dramatic 2-1 victory at St Mary's.

arts.ttl: Manning and Stephens’ late show earns Southampton dramatic win against Wrexham
arts.athr: Ben Fisher at St Mary's Stadium
arts.sum: Ninety minutes before kick-off a couple of digivans poking fun at Wrexham completed another lap of St Mary’s, whizzing past with a LED billboard that read: “Who needs Hollywood?” with the letters of Southampton studded in the Californian hills. On this evidence the Welsh club – back at this level for the first time since 1982 after an extraordinary rise from non-league – are sure to be a fun addition, but how they were given a galling reminder of the step up, Saints scoring twice in the final nine minutes to earn a comeback victory and a first under Will Still.
